175.title: Ammonia leaks from H'yana factory; breathing difficulties reported
175.article_body: Workers at a factory in Haryana's Jhajjar were evacuated and water was sprayed after the factory reported an ammonia gas leak on Thursday night. Some residents in the area complained of difficulty in breathing and vomiting, while the condition of two firefighters reportedly also deteriorated during the relief work. Meanwhile, the Additional Deputy Commissioner advised people to wear masks.

176.title: Violence doesn’t benefit anybody: Mohan Bhagwat on communal violence incidents
176.article_body: Speaking about the communal clashes which erupted in some states during Ram Navami and Hanuman Jayanti, RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat said that violence does not benefit anybody. "The society to which violence is dear is now counting its last days...For this, it is essential to bring together all communities...We all need to do this work on a priority," Bhagwat said.

177.title: Illegal arms dealer held in Kolkata, 2 country-made pistols recovered
177.article_body: The Special Task Force of Kolkata Police arrested an illegal arms dealer from city's Parsi Bagan lane area on Thursday. The police also recovered two country-made improvised firearms along with other items. The accused, identified as Ajijur Momin, is a resident of Malda. He will be produced before the court on Friday.

178.title: Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp extends contract until 2026
178.article_body: Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp has signed a contract extension until 2026 with his previous deal due to expire in 2024. "There is a freshness about us as a club...and this energises me," said Klopp. Ex-Liverpool player José Enrique had earlier tweeted that Klopp's contract extension is better than Liverpool signing forwards Kylian Mbappé and Erling Haaland at the same time.

179.title: Real tech skills lead to remarkable outcomes: Scaler
179.article_body: Scaler Academy highlights the value of real tech skills for impactful career results. It promises the right learning environment including dedicated mentorship & an industry-fit curriculum taught by experienced instructors. From achieving 126% average salary hike to being placed at top tech companies like Amazon, Microsoft, Flipkart & more, our alumni utilise skills to create impact, said Scaler.

180.title: Boman shares pic with Vicky, Anupam; fan says 'Too much talent in 1 frame'
180.article_body: Taking to Instagram, Boman Irani shared a picture of himself with Anupam Kher and Vicky Kaushal. "He's what we call 'a good lad'...A gentle soul and a lot more dear, Vicky Kaushal," he wrote. Reacting to Boman's post, a fan wrote, "Too much talent in one frame," while another said, "It'd be good to see...three of you together on screen."

181.title: Delhi-Meerut RRTS corridor to get first train next month
181.article_body: The priority section of the Regional Rapid Transit System (RRTS) will get its first train for the Delhi-Meerut route next month. The first train set will arrive from the Savli plant in Gujarat, an official said. The 17 km-long priority section, which is between Sahibabad and Duhai depot (Ghaziabad), will be made operational for public use by March next year.

182.title: 22-yr-old mentally challenged man sodomised in Ludhiana; 1 booked
182.article_body: Punjab Police booked one person after a 22-year-old mentally challenged man was allegedly sodomised in Ludhiana's Assi Kalan village. His mother told police that her son had gone for a walk on April 25 when the accused took him to bushes near canal and sexually assaulted him. He threatened him with dire consequences if he spoke to anyone, she alleged.

183.title: Mumbai-based drone manufacturer ideaForge raises ₹153 crore
183.article_body: Mumbai-based drone manufacturer ideaForge has raised around ₹153 crore in its Series B funding round led by Florintree. The round also saw participation from its existing investors such as ﻿Celesta Capital﻿, Infosys, Qualcomm and Infina, along with the Exim Bank of India. The startup claims to be having repeat contracts from the Indian Army for its SWITCH UAVs.

184.title: Hindu activists threaten 'suicide' over UP rly station temple's removal
184.article_body: Hindu right-wing activists have allegedly threatened to commit mass suicide if a 250-year-old temple is removed from the Raja Ki Mandi Railway Station's platform in Uttar Pradesh's Agra. This comes after Railways had issued a notice to shift the temple from the station's premises. A similar notice was also sent to a dargah and mosque at Agra Cantt Railway Station.

185.title: Chiranjeevi wasn't sure if hitting me will be accepted: Sood on playing antagonist
185.article_body: Sonu Sood has said his philanthropy work has made it difficult for people to cast him in negative roles as they are afraid that audience might not accept it. The actor, who plays an antagonist in 'Acharya', added the makers had to "rework...on a few scenes" after COVID-19. "Chiranjeevi...wasn't sure if hitting me will be accepted by people," said Sood.

186.title: I don't know what is going on in Virat Kohli's head: Ganguly on Kohli's poor form
186.article_body: Referring to Virat Kohli's poor batting form, BCCI President Sourav Ganguly said, "I don't know what is going on in Kohli's head." He added, "But I am sure he will regain his form and get some good runs. He is a great player." Kohli has scored 128 runs in nine IPL 2022 matches so far.

187.title: IndiGo becomes first airline to land aircraft using Indian navigation system 'GAGAN'
187.article_body: IndiGo has become the first airline in India to land its aircraft using the indigenous navigation system 'GAGAN'. The airline said the flight was conducted using an ATR aircraft and landed at Kishangarh airport in Rajasthan on Wednesday morning. GPS-aided geo-augmented navigation (GAGAN) has been developed jointly by Airports Authority of India (AAI) and Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO).

188.title: What action has IMD suggested amid heat wave in several parts of the country?
188.article_body: Amid intensifying heat wave in several parts of the country, IMD has suggested action for citizens. It has urged citizens to avoid heat exposure and avoid dehydration. "Drink sufficient water, even if not thirsty. Wear lightweight, light-coloured, loose, cotton clothes and cover the head by use of cloth, hat or umbrella etc," it said.

189.title: People run for their lives as US family brings unexploded shell at airport in Israel
189.article_body: A video shows people running for their lives at an airport in Israel after a US family brought an unexploded shell. The family picked up the artillery shell while in Golan Heights and decided to pack it in their luggage, according to authorities. The family was allowed to board their flight after being interrogated by security, who declared an all-clear.

190.title: Don't employ bouncers at bars, pubs in GB Nagar: Excise dept
190.article_body: The excise department met all GB Nagar based pub and bar owners and directed them not to employ bouncers at their establishments. This comes after a 30-year-old man died after he was allegedly assaulted during a brawl in a pub in Noida's Gardens Galleria mall. Excise officials said there are 83 licenses issued for pubs and bars in GB Nagar.

191.title: 97 kg heroin, other drugs worth ₹300 cr seized from house in Delhi's Shaheen Bagh
191.article_body: Narcotics Control Bureau (NCB) on Thursday seized over 97 kilograms of heroin, 47 kilograms of other narcotics and ₹30 lakh cash from a house in Delhi's Shaheen Bagh, officials said. The seized drugs are worth ₹300 crore, as per reports. "The drugs...stored in travel bags, backpacks and jute sacks. We suspect...money seized was received through Hawala channels," police said.

192.title: It hurts when I see the situation of Barcelona: Ex-Barca manager Koeman
192.article_body: Ex-Barcelona manager Ronald Koeman said it "hurts" him when he sees the situation of Barcelona, adding that changing the manager doesn't always mean being able to improve. "I didn't have the club's full support. I hope [current manager] Xavi does," stated Koeman. Barcelona trail Real Madrid, who are on top of the La Liga points table by 15 points.

193.title: WB govt making special provisions for Ukraine-returned citizens: CM
193.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee has said that the government is making special provisions for all the 422 Ukraine-returned citizens from the state, including 419 students. "The Union government has shown an indifferent approach about their future," she added. "We have already employed two persons as contractual workers at the district magistrate's office," Banerjee further said.

194.title: KKR have many loopholes, death bowling has always been an issue: Jaffer
194.article_body: Ex-India opener Wasim Jaffer said KKR have many loopholes like their openers not doing well and spinners not being as impressive, adding that their death bowling has "always" been an issue. "KKR are relying heavily on Shreyas Iyer and Andre Russell. The other guys [should]...step up," added Jaffer. KKR recorded their fifth consecutive defeat in IPL 2022 against DC.

195.title: CNG price hiked by ₹2.20/kg in Pune in 4th hike this month
195.article_body: The price of Compressed Natural Gas (CNG) was hiked by ₹2.20/kg in Pune on Thursday for the fourth consecutive time in April, taking the CNG price to ₹77.20/kg in the city. In April, CNG price witnessed a hike from ₹62.20 to ₹68, then to ₹73. On April 19, the price again raised to ₹75, before the latest hike.

196.title: Manish Pandey hasn't looked in good rhythm since 2-3 seasons: Chawla
196.article_body: Cricketer-commentator Piyush Chawla said LSG batter Manish Pandey has "not looked" in good rhythm in IPL 2022 so far, adding that Pandey hasn't been in good rhythm since the last two to three IPL seasons. "It is a concern," added Chawla. Manish has scored 88 runs in IPL 2022 so far at a strike rate of 110.

197.title: 57-yr-old man dies during raid on video parlour in Mumbai's Mulund
197.article_body: A 57-year-old man died during a police raid on a video parlour in Mumbai's Mulund area on Thursday. According to an official, the crime branch had raided the parlour for allegedly operating illegally around 5 pm. The deceased, who was among those detained, began feeling unwell and was rushed to hospital where he was declared dead, the official added.

198.title: Hyderabad Police detains 3 men for cheating people via investment scam
198.article_body: Hyderabad's Rachakonda Police on Thursday detained three men for allegedly cheating people of about ₹6 crore on the pretext of an investment fund with high-interest rates. According to police, the accused lured people by giving them 10% interest on their initial invested amount. Though people received returns in beginning, later the accused stopped responding to the victims, police added.

199.title: Wedding procession moves under shade of pandal amid heatwave in India; video viral
199.article_body: In a video being widely circulated on social media, a wedding procession is seen moving ahead under the shade of a pandal amid the heatwave in the country. The clip shared by Twitter user Devyani Kohli has more than 19,000 views so far. Reacting to the video, users commented, "We are Jugaad king," and "Amazing."

200.title: DC's Sakariya's wicket celebration goes viral, says 'It was for my late father'
200.article_body: DC pacer Chetan Sakariya's 'Black Panther' and 'Goku' celebration after taking KKR opener Aaron Finch's wicket went viral. Talking about it, Sakariya said, "It was an emotional celebration. It was for my late father. He always wanted me to clean bowl an international batter." "[The celebration] signifies me going to my father and telling him, 'I did it'," he stated.

201.title: Man sexually harasses sister, her 9-yr-old daughter in Pune; held
201.article_body: Pune's Pimpri-Chinchwad Police have arrested a 28-year-old man for allegedly sexually harassing his sister and her nine-year-old daughter. The man's mother claimed that in one incident her son pulled down her granddaughter's clothes and in another, he tugged at her hand and asked her to come to his bed after eating dinner. Both the incidents reportedly occurred in April.

202.title: Only impart Bible-based moral science lessons: B'luru school head
202.article_body: The principal of Bengaluru's Clarence High School, which is involved in the Bible row, had denied the allegation that non-Christian students are forced to learn the Bible and said that only moral science lessons based on the text are imparted. He added that parents and students actually "appreciate" the school for teaching moral values and this has invited more admissions.

203.title: Pakistan PM, ministers received with chants of 'chor-chor' in Saudi; video surfaces
203.article_body: A video shows people chanting "chor-chor" as Pakistan PM Shehbaz Sharif and other ministers made their way to Masjid-e-Nabawi in Medina. Sharif and his delegation had reached Saudi Arabia on Thursday for a three-day official visit. "I don't want to name the person responsible for this," Information Minister Marriyum Aurangzeb said in an apparent reference to ex-PM Imran Khan.

204.title: Musk's initial 9% Twitter stake purchase under probe in US: Report
204.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk's initial 9% Twitter stake purchase in early April is being probed by the US FTC, The Information reported. The FTC is probing if Musk complied with an antitrust reporting requirement when he bought the stake. It's focussing on whether Musk bought the stake to influence Twitter's management or if he looked to be a passive shareholder.

205.title: Moment of pride: Arvind Kejriwal praises Atishi on her UN address
205.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal congratulated AAP leader Atishi on her UN General Assembly address and called it "a very proud moment". Atishi highlighted the AAP government's governance model at the UNGA. "Many congratulations on making the whole world aware of the potential of the country including the sentiments of the people of Delhi...India now wants to move forward," Kejriwal said.

206.title: 26-year-old woman accuses Shiv Sena MP Rahul Shewale of rape
206.article_body: A 26-year-old woman on Thursday accused Shiv Sena MP Rahul Shewale of rape, police said. The woman lodged a complaint at Mumbai's Sakinaka Police Station, an official said. No FIR has been registered so far and the police were yet to start a probe into the complaint, the official added. Shewale has denied the accusation and called the complaint "conspiracy".

207.title: Himachal's Sach Pass reopens for light vehicles after 6 months
207.article_body: The Sach Pass, which connects Chamba with the remote Pangi valley in Himachal Pradesh, has been reopened for light vehicles after a gap of over six months, said Deputy Commissioner DC Rana. The snow clearance operation has been partially completed at the pass, Rana added. "The work to open the route for heavy vehicles is still underway," he said.

208.title: Committed to helping you invest as the ultra-wealthy do: dezerv.
208.article_body: Co-founders of dezerv., who have managed money for India's wealthiest families for 16+ years, believe that India has one of the greatest wealth inequalities. This defined their mission: to help working professionals invest as the ultra-wealthy do. They believe every person should have access to experts for their investments to avoid mistakes that could make them lose their hard-earned money.

209.title: Vidya to reunite with 'Shakuntala Devi' director for murder mystery 'Neeyat'
209.article_body: Actress Vidya Balan is reuniting with 'Shakuntala Devi' director Anu Menon for another film, titled 'Neeyat'. The upcoming murder mystery will also feature Ram Kapoor, Shahana Goswami, Shashank Arora, Mita Vasisht, Prajakta Koli, Neeraj Kabi and Amrita Puri. "I have loved the work of all...people working on this movie...It feels great to be working with all of them," Vidya said.

210.title: Man puts up loudspeakers at temples in UP's Saharanpur; arrested
210.article_body: A man was arrested on Thursday for allegedly putting up loudspeakers at temples in Uttar Pradesh's Saharanpur. This comes a day after the state government said that it had removed 10,900 "illegal and unauthorised" loudspeakers from religious places. The man, Vishu Kambojh alias Shanky, was identified as a member of the Hindu Yodha Parivar, the city's Superintendent of Police said.

211.title: SRH will feel the pain when he scores: Sehwag on Warner's 26-ball 42 vs KKR
211.article_body: Talking about DC opener David Warner's 42 off 26 balls in DC's win against KKR, ex-India opener Virender Sehwag said Warner's former franchise SRH will feel the "pain" whenever he scores runs. "Warner deserves credit for SRH's title victory [in 2016]," added Sehwag. Warner was picked by DC in the IPL mega auction having been earlier released by SRH.

212.title: China's Weibo publishes users' IP locations to combat 'bad behaviour'
212.article_body: China's Weibo has started publishing users' IP locations on their account pages and when they post comments, in a move to combat "bad behaviour" online. For users in China, Weibo will display their province or municipality, while for overseas users IP addresses will be shown. Several users welcomed Weibo's decision, while several others brought up anonymity issues.

213.title: No major communal violence in past 7-8 yrs: Naqvi to EU team
213.article_body: Union Minority Affairs Minister Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi who on Thursday met a European Union (EU) delegation, told Indian Express that he clarified to them that "there's been no major incident of communal violence in the past seven-eight years." He said that he did so after the delegation raised concerns over bureaucrats writing PM Narendra Modi a letter on the matter.

214.title: Mohammad Kaif names his all-time IPL XI, includes 5 Indians
214.article_body: Former India batter Mohammad Kaif has named his all-time IPL XI, which includes five Indians and six foreigners. Kaif named Chris Gayle and Rohit Sharma as openers, and MS Dhoni as the wicketkeeper-captain of the side. Other players include Virat Kohli, Suresh Raina, AB de Villiers, Andre Russell, Rashid Khan, Sunil Narine, Jasprit Bumrah and Lasith Malinga.

215.title: India reports 3,377 COVID-19 cases, 60 deaths in last 24 hours
215.article_body: India reported 3,377 COVID-19 cases and 60 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 3,303 COVID-19 cases and 39 deaths. Active cases in India stand at 17,801, while the death toll has risen to 5,23,753.

216.title: Airbnb tells employees they can work remotely forever
216.article_body: Airbnb told its 6,000 employees that they would have the option to permanently work remotely. The home-renting marketplace also told its US employees that they could move to anywhere in the country without a reduction to their compensation. Airbnb CEO Brian Chesky said that permanent flexibility will allow the company to "hire and retain the best people in the world".

217.title: Woman forced to give massage to policeman inside Bihar police station; video surfaces
217.article_body: A woman was forced to give massage to a police official inside a police station in Bihar's Saharsa district to reportedly get her son out of jail. The police official has been suspended after the video of him receiving massage went viral on social media. Sub Divisional Police Officer (SDPO), Sadar, Santosh Kumar confirmed the authenticity of the video.

218.title: BMC reduces number of COVID-19 vaccination centres due to low turnout
218.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) is shutting down COVID-19 vaccination centres (CVCs) with zero or less than 10% footfall as the civic body said that Mumbai's adult population is now fully vaccinated. The number of people eligible for booster doses is close to four lakh and these people won't turn up together at the same time, the BMC said.

219.title: Name villages after Milkha, Lata, Rafi: Delhi BJP to Kejriwal
219.article_body: Delhi Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) chief Adesh Gupta has asked Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal to rename 40 villages, including Hauz Khas and Sheikh Sarai, in the national capital on Thursday. He suggested these villages should be named after singers Lata Mangeshkar and Mohammed Rafi, shehnai maestro Bismillah Khan, sportsperson Milkha Singh and Kargil war martyr Captain Vikram Batra among others.

220.title: Demolition firm seeks time extension in Noida Supertech twin towers case
220.article_body: Edifice Engineering, the firm hired by Supertech to demolish the 40-storey Noida twin towers on May 22, has sought an extension of time, citing inputs from foreign experts engaged for the work. "The engineering firm has to comply with the agreement signed with Supertech," Noida Authority CEO Ritu Maheshwari said. "We can't allow time extensions on our own," Maheshwari added.

221.title: Aave CEO briefly suspended from Twitter after joke on being its interim CEO
221.article_body: DeFi protocol Aave's CEO Stani Kulechov's Twitter account was briefly suspended after he joked about being appointed Twitter's "interim CEO". However, less than 24 hours after the suspension, Twitter reversed its decision. After the suspension was lifted, Kulechov tweeted, "I'm back as interim CEO of Twitter." Prior to his suspension, Kulechov had thanked Elon Musk for the opportunity.

222.title: Chinchwad remains hottest area in Pune for 3rd straight day
222.article_body: Amid the ongoing heatwave-like conditions, Chinchwad (43.6°C) remained the hottest area of Pune city for the third consecutive day on Thursday, the India Meteorological Department (IMD) said. Other areas which followed Chinchwad were Lavale (42.6°C), Shivajinagar and Pashan (41.8°C) and Lohegaon (41.7°C). Notably, Pune's day temperature was 3 to 5 degrees above normal, IMD's data said.

223.title: It shocked me: UN chief as 2 Russian missiles hit Ukraine during his visit
223.article_body: After two Russian missiles hit Ukraine's Kyiv during a visit by UN Secretary General Antonio Guterres, he said, "It shocked me, not because I'm here but because Kyiv is a sacred city for Ukrainians and Russians alike." Meanwhile Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said the blasts "prove that we must not drop our vigilance".

224.title: Want to make the biggest show: Rohit Shetty on 'Indian Police Force'
224.article_body: Filmmaker Rohit Shetty, speaking about his upcoming show 'Indian Police Force', said, "My only aim is to make it big. The biggest series." "We've been watching a lot of series from abroad...Nothing wrong in it but it's time something has to go from India...that's what I want to do," he added. It stars Sidharth Malhotra, Shilpa Shetty and Vivek Oberoi.

225.title: None of their players have got going: Vettori on KKR's loss vs DC
225.article_body: Reacting to KKR's defeat by four wickets against DC, ex-New Zealand captain Daniel Vettori said, "None of their players have just been able to get going." "[Opener] Aaron Finch has been unsettled," added Vettori. "KKR have more questions to answer than DC," stated former West Indies pacer Ian Bishop. KKR have now recorded their fifth consecutive defeat.

226.title: Jharkhand govt has become king of thieves: Arjun Munda
226.article_body: Union Minister Arjun Munda criticised the JMM-led Jharkhand government and said that the state government has become the "king of thieves". "What is happening in Jharkhand? Illegal mining is being done, loots, coal 'mafiagiri' is being done openly. The state government is not understanding why the public has chosen them... there's a lot of mismanagement," the former Jharkhand CM said.

227.title: Ugandan student falls to death from hostel's 6th floor in B'luru
227.article_body: A 24-year-old student from Uganda died after she fell from the sixth floor of the hostel building at Gitam University in Bengaluru's Doddaballapura. The incident reportedly occurred on Wednesday when the deceased tried to pick up clothes that'd fallen on a sheet at the building's edge. The death led to protests by students and some students also vandalised buildings.

228.title: Man molests 13-yr-old girl at Mumbai's Dadar railway station, held
228.article_body: A 32-year-old man has been arrested for allegedly molesting a 13-year-old girl at Dadar railway station in Mumbai. The incident occurred on Wednesday evening when the girl was sitting with her grandfather on a bench. The accused allegedly sat down next to the victim and started touching her inappropriately following which she raised an alarm, police said.

229.title: Bus hits 9 vehicles after brake failure in Pune; 1 dead, 7 injured
229.article_body: At least one person died and seven others were injured after a Maharashtra state transport bus rammed into nine other vehicles in Pune's Balaji Nagar on Thursday, police officials said. The incident allegedly occurred as the driver lost control due to suspected brake failure, a police inspector said. Over 20 passengers were on board the bus when the incident occurred.

230.title: 3-yr-old killed, 10 injured as vehicle falls into gorge in Chamba
230.article_body: A three-year-old boy died and nine other children were injured after a Bolero carrying them fell into a gorge in Chamba. The driver, along with three children, has been seriously injured. As per police, the vehicle that used to ferry students of a private school met with an accident after the driver lost control of it while negotiating a curve.

231.title: Power supply to Metro, hospitals could be interrupted amid coal shortage: Delhi govt
231.article_body: Coal crisis in the national capital could hit essential services like Delhi Metro and hospitals, Delhi government said on Thursday. Coal in two of the five stations from where Delhi sources power would last only about one or two days, it added. "Delhi government...appealed to the Centre to provide an adequate supply of coal," Power Minister Satyendar Jain said.

232.title: Shahid Afridi is characterless, he conspired against me for being a Hindu: Kaneria
232.article_body: Ex-Pakistan leg-spinner Danish Kaneria claimed that Shahid Afridi conspired against him for being a Hindu. "I was always degraded by Afridi...He didn't want me to be in team...He'd go to other players and provoke them against me. I was performing well and he was jealous of me," Kaneria added. "He was a liar, manipulator...because he's a characterless person," Kaneria stated.

233.title: Fireball flying at 88,500 kmph spotted over US, causes loud boom
233.article_body: A fireball was spotted by residents of US' states of Arkansas, Louisiana and Mississippi. Several people reported hearing loud booms. As per NASA, the object, thought to be a piece of an asteroid, was about a foot in diameter and weighed 40 kg. "[It] moved southwest at a speed of 55,000 mph (over 88,500 kmph)," NASA further said.

234.title: Mumbai's Mulund station bags award for best cleaned suburban station of CR
234.article_body: Mumbai division's Mulund station bagged the award for being the cleanest suburban station on Central Railway and Asangaon stood second in the same category. At present, Mulund station handles around 1,000 local trains daily, experiencing an average daily footfall of around 2.5 lakh passengers. Mulund station has 54 twin dustbins for the segregation of waste at the source.

235.title: India responds after Pakistan PM Sharif terms PM Modi's visit to J&K as 'staged'
235.article_body: After Pakistan PM Shehbaz Sharif termed PM Narendra Modi's visit to J&K as "staged", External Affairs Ministry said, "Pakistan has no locus standi to comment on matters pertaining to the Union Territory." "We don't understand the word staged. It seems to indicate the visit did not take place and we are trying to show that it did," the ministry added.

236.title: Musk sells Tesla shares worth $4 bn, says no further sales planned
236.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has sold 4.4 million Tesla shares worth nearly $4 billion, filings showed. Commenting on the sale he said, "No further TSLA sales planned after today." Earlier this week, Tesla lost $126 billion in value amid investor concerns that Musk may sell shares to fund his $21 billion equity contribution to his $44-billion Twitter deal.

237.title: Woman in possession of swamp deer horns worth ₹1.5 cr held in Delhi
237.article_body: A 23-year-old woman possessing swamp deer horns worth around ₹1.5 crore was arrested from Delhi's Timarpur area, police said. The woman, a resident of Aruna Nagar, allegedly wanted to sell the horns, according to the police. The accused revealed that she had bought the horns from a resident of UP's Bahraich to sell them in Delhi, police added.

238.title: Gurugram to soon offer option of booking city bus seats using Uber
238.article_body: Gurugram Metropolitan City Bus Limited will soon start a special bus service where commuters can book their bus seats through the Uber app, making it a first-of-its-kind service in India. The special service will initially run on pilot basis for nine months on two routes. The buses will make three round trips each in the morning and evening.

239.title: DC hand KKR their 5th straight defeat in IPL 2022, move to 6th on IPL 2022 points table
239.article_body: Delhi Capitals (DC) defeated Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) by four wickets in their IPL 2022 match to move to the sixth position on the points table. KKR have now lost five matches in a row and are placed eighth on the points table. David Warner top-scored for DC with 42(26), while Kuldeep Yadav took four wickets.

240.title: 7 people arrested for throwing objectionable items outside mosques in Ayodhya
240.article_body: Police has arrested seven persons for allegedly throwing objectionable items and torn pages of religious texts outside three mosques and a shrine in Ayodhya on Wednesday. "It came to light that they wanted to ruin the amicable atmosphere and peaceful tradition of this city," Senior Superintendent of Police (Ayodhya) Shailesh Kumar Pandey said. Four people are yet to be arrested.

241.title: Get listed in India, don't leave for 'few dollars more': Goyal to startups
241.article_body: Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal on Thursday urged startups to get incorporated and listed in India and not leave the country "just for few dollars more". "If you have an issue or problem, please tell us about it. We'll...make every effort to resolve [it]," Goyal said. He added that startups too need to strengthen ethics and corporate governance standards.

242.title: Govt asks state-run firms to consider buying Russian oil assets: Report
242.article_body: The Oil Ministry has reportedly asked state-run energy firms, including ONGC Videsh Ltd (OVL) and Indian Oil Corporation, to consider buying BP's stake in sanction-hit Russia's petroleum firm Rosneft. It comes after BP announced it's exiting its 19.75% stake in Rosneft. India hopes to get stakes in Russian assets at discounted rates given the risk involved, a source told Reuters.

243.title: Centre should take steps to curb fuel price hike: Kerala CM
243.article_body: Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan said that people's suffering due to fuel price hike cannot be mitigated by blaming the states. The Centre should take steps to curb the increase in the rates, he added. This comes a day after PM Narendra Modi said non-reduction of VAT by some states was the reason for skyrocketing costs of fuel.

244.title: Congress can revive itself, doesn't need me: Prashant Kishor
244.article_body: After declining Congress' offer to join the party, poll strategist Prashant Kishor said that the Congress can revive itself and does not need him. "The Congress leadership and I agreed on several things with regard to the party's future plan," Kishor said. They can revive the party on their own, they have so many big leaders, he added.

245.title: Olivia Wilde served custody documents from ex-fiance on stage: Report
245.article_body: Actress Olivia Wilde was handed over an envelope which reportedly consisted of legal custody documents of her children from her ex-fiance Jason Sudeikis while she was on stage at the CinemaCon. "Jason would never condone her being served in such an inappropriate manner," a source close to Jason told Variety. The duo were engaged but got separated in 2020.

246.title: My picture was uploaded on a porn site when I was 15: Urfi Javed
246.article_body: Urfi Javed recalled an incident of slut-shaming when she was 15. "I was in Lucknow...and I wore an off-shoulder top. In Lucknow, we never got such clothes back then...I uploaded the picture on Facebook and someone uploaded that on a porn site," she said. "People...slut-shamed me, the entire town, my family...they were like 'It was all your fault'," said Urfi.

247.title: Electric pole falls on man, 4 Navi Mumbai civic staff booked
247.article_body: At least four members of Navi Mumbai Municipal Corporation (NMMC) were booked for negligence after a street pole fell on a food vendor. The incident took place when NMMC staff were erecting a new street light pole in Sanpada. Food vendor Ganesh Chelaswami Hikutty went to enquire when the work would be done and the pole fell on his shoulder.

248.title: Twitter overcounted its users for 3 years due to an error
248.article_body: Twitter admitted it overcounted its monetisable daily active usage/users (mDAU) from Q1 2019 through Q4 2021. "In March 2019, we launched a feature to let people link multiple separate accounts together to conveniently switch between accounts," said Twitter. "An error was made at that time...actions taken via primary account resulted in all linked accounts being counted as mDAU," added Twitter.

249.title: Parliamentary panel summons Amazon, Google over competitive conduct
249.article_body: The Parliamentary Panel on Finance has said it'll summon Google, Amazon, Twitter, Facebook, Apple and Microsoft among others to discuss their competitive behaviour. It comes as the Competition Commission of India (CCI) on Thursday told the panel that it was setting up a 'Digital Markets and Data Unit' for dealing with anti-competition practices of big tech companies.

250.title: Main accused in Rajasthan doctor suicide case arrested
250.article_body: The main accused in the alleged suicide case of Dr Archana Sharma was arrested by police in Dausa, Rajasthan. Police said the accused, Shiv Shanker Joshi alias Baliya Joshi, was arrested outside a news channel office as soon as he came out. Gynaecologist Dr Archana Sharma allegedly died by suicide on March 29 after a case was registered against her.

251.title: Delhi sees warmest April day in 12 years at 43.5° C: Report
251.article_body: Delhi witnessed its warmest April day in 12 years on Thursday amid heatwave, with the Safdarjung observatory recording a maximum temperature of 43.5° C, PTI reported. Delhi had registered a maximum temperature of 43.7° C on April 18, 2010, while its all-time high temperature for April was 45.6° C recorded on April 29, 1941, the report added.

252.title: Delhi sees nearly 1,500 new COVID-19 cases, active cases cross 5,000
252.article_body: Delhi's active COVID-19 cases have crossed the 5,000 mark on Thursday as nearly 1,500 (1,490) people tested positive for the virus in the city in the last 24 hours. The national capital also reported two coronavirus-related deaths on Thursday, while 1,070 people recovered from the disease in one day. Delhi's daily positivity rate jumped to 4.62% from 4.50% on Wednesday.

253.title: Google blocked 12 lakh Play Store apps, 1.9 lakh developers in 2021
253.article_body: Google has revealed that it blocked 12 lakh "policy violating apps" from being published on Play Store in 2021. According to Google, it also banned 1,90,000 "malicious and spammy" developer accounts and closed around 5,00,000 developer accounts that were "inactive or abandoned". "Last year we introduced multiple privacy-focused features...and improved SDK data safety," Google stated.

254.title: Maha govt delaying establishment of Vajpayee statue in Mumbai: BJP
254.article_body: BJP MP Gopal Shetty has accused the Maharashtra government of deliberately delaying the establishment of the statue of former PM Atal Bihari Vajpayee in Mumbai's Kandivali. "Permission from the 12 departments of the Maharashtra government has been granted," Gopal Shetty said. One minister belonging to the Sports department of Congress quota has not permitted it yet, he added.

255.title: Use bulldozers on criminals, not on temples: BJP MP to Raj govt
255.article_body: Condemning Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot over the Dausa gang-rape and murder, Rajasthan BJP MP Ram Kumar Verma said that the government should use bulldozers on criminals and not on temples. "The Home Minister who is also the Chief Minister is responsible for such incidents because he has no control over it and has become insensitive," Verma said.

256.title: Israelis across country observe 2-minute silence to mark Holocaust Day
256.article_body: Israelis on Thursday paused as two-minute sirens across the country sounded off to mark Holocaust Remembrance Day, an annual ritual honouring 6 million Jews killed during World War II. People halted where they were walking and drivers stepped out of their vehicles to bow their heads in memory of victims. Over 1,60,000 survivors of the Holocaust live in Israel today.

257.title: No Entry 2 will star Salman, Anil, Fardeen; shoot to begin soon: Anees
257.article_body: Filmmaker Anees Bazmee has said that the shooting 'No Entry' sequel is going to start "very soon". "I've met Salman Khan four to five times and I've told him that we'll start filming soon," he added. Anees confirmed that Anil Kapoor and Fardeen Khan, who were part of the 2005 film, will also feature in the sequel.

258.title: Ukraine war delayed delivery of Vande Bharat trains' components: MEA
258.article_body: External Affairs Ministry Spokesperson Arindam Bagchi said the delivery of components of the Vande Bharat trains has been affected by the Russia-Ukraine war. "The war has impacted [the] delivery schedule [of the trains' components]. We are looking at options to ensure timely delivery," Bagchi said. India had reportedly ordered 36,000 wheels for $16 million from a firm based in Ukraine.

259.title: Ukraine conflict highlights need for self-reliance: Rajnath Singh
259.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh on Thursday said the ongoing Russia-Ukraine conflict highlighted the need for achieving self-reliance in defence. "Indian Navy, which has been at the forefront of 'Aatmanirbhar Bharat' initiative, must continue to lead the way and remain a necessary guarantor of India's maritime trade, security and national prosperity," Singh said.

260.title: Adam Levine is the reason wife Portia & I are together: Ellen
260.article_body: 'The Ellen Show' host Ellen DeGeneres said singer Adam Levine is the reason why she and her wife Portia de Rossi are together. In a recent appearance on 'The Ellen Show', Adam told Ellen, "We won't go into detail...it's private stuff, I'm technically the reason you met Portia." "Well not why I met her, but why we're together," Ellen stated.

261.title: WB govt to accommodate Ukraine-returned students in state colleges
261.article_body: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee announced on Thursday that her government will accommodate students who returned from Ukraine in state colleges. The sixth-year students will be allowed to undergo internships at government medical colleges. The fifth-year, fourth-year students will be allowed to undergo 'observing seats' in colleges in a manner that makes it 15-20 students per college.

262.title: 2 girls playing hide-and-seek die inside ice cream freezer in K'taka
262.article_body: Two girls died due to suffocation after hiding inside an abandoned ice cream freezer while playing hide-and-seek with friends in Karnataka's Mysuru on Wednesday, police said. According to the police, the girls entered the freezer, which was left unattended in their area. When they closed the door, it automatically got locked and they got trapped inside, police added.

263.title: Sweden has failed to integrate immigrants, crime has gone up: PM
263.article_body: Swedish PM Magdalena Andersson said on Thursday that Sweden has failed to integrate immigrants over the last two decades, leading to increased gang violence in the country. Andersson made the remarks as she launched a series of initiatives to combat organised crime. Violent riots broke out in Sweden's Norrkoping city earlier this month after a politician burnt the Quran.

264.title: Rare, giant serpent-like creature washes up on New Zealand beach; pic goes viral
264.article_body: An extremely rare, giant serpent-like creature from the deep sea recently washed up on a New Zealand beach. A marine biologist investigated the discovery and identified it as an oarfish. A video shared online shows the creature lurking in shallow waters and a man can be heard saying in the background, "It feels like a shark."

265.title: Kuldeep records his best IPL bowling figures, takes 8 wickets in 2 matches vs ex-team KKR
265.article_body: DC chinaman bowler Kuldeep Yadav recorded his best bowling figures in IPL on Thursday by registering figures of 3-0-14-4 against KKR. The 27-year-old has now taken a total of eight wickets in two IPL 2022 matches against his former team KKR. Kuldeep's previous best bowling figures in IPL were 4-0-20-4, recorded against RR in IPL 2018.

266.title: Patently untrue: Minister on claim that T'gana CM was told to stay away from PM's event
266.article_body: Union Minister Jitendra Singh dismissed KT Rama Rao's claim that PMO had instructed Telangana CM and his father K Chandrashekar Rao to stay away from PM Narendra Modi's programmes in Telangana last year and in February. "This is patently untrue. No such message was sent by the PMO. Infact, the CM...was expected at the events on 5th February," Singh tweeted.

267.title: Pochettino says Mbappe, himself will '100%' be at PSG next season
267.article_body: PSG manager Mauricio Pochettino said both he and Kylian Mbappe will "100%" be at the club next season. "This is football and we never know what might happen," the Argentinian said. Mbappe is out of contract this summer amid speculation over a move to Real Madrid. Regarding his own future Pochettino said that "there haven't been any concrete talks".

268.title: Excited to trade kicks with Akshay Kumar in 'Bade Miyan...': Tiger
268.article_body: Actor Tiger Shroff has said that he is "very excited" about his upcoming film 'Bade Miyan Chote Miyan', which will also feature Akshay Kumar. Speaking about working with Akshay, Tiger said, "I am getting to work with one of my onscreen idols, Akshay Kumar sir, the original 'Khiladi'. So I'm just excited to trade kicks with him."

269.title: Major tragedy averted as IED found along highway in Jammu: Police
269.article_body: A major tragedy was averted after police recovered an improvised explosive device (IED) at Sidhra along the Jammu-Srinagar national highway on Thursday, J&K Police said. According to officials, the IED was planted along the highway by suspected terrorists. Police said the area was cordoned off immediately, and the bomb squad destroyed the explosive device through a controlled mechanism.

270.title: Amravati MP & husband seek home-made food in jail, file plea in court
270.article_body: Amravati Independent MP Navneet Rana and her husband MLA Ravi Rana have filed a petition in a sessions court in Mumbai seeking home-made food in jail. The plea's hearing will take place on April 29. The couple was arrested and sent to 14-day judicial custody on Sunday after they threatened to recite Hanuman Chalisa outside Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray's residence.

271.title: Man shoots himself after killing ex-wife & daughter in the middle of the road in Bihar
271.article_body: In an incident reported from Bihar's capital Patna, a man first killed his divorced wife and daughter and later shot himself dead in the middle of the road. The incident took place on Thursday. The deceased accused has been identified as Rajeev. According to police, the murders seem to be the result of a family dispute.

272.title: Esha reacts as trolls say she looks like brother Bobby in new hairstyle
272.article_body: Esha Deol has reacted to trolls who said she looked like her brother Bobby Deol after her pictures with her new hairstyle were posted by the paparazzi. On Instagram Stories, Esha said her hair was "messy" because she shot for an action sequence. "If I do look like...Bobby in that hairdo...I'd like to thank you for the compliment," she added.

273.title: Barcelona to play 2023-24 season in Olympic Stadium
273.article_body: Barcelona will move to the Olympic Stadium for the 2023-24 season due to planned renovation of the Camp Nou. Work on the first and second tiers of the stadium will begin this June. The third tier of the 99,000 capacity stadium will be demolished in the summer of 2023. Barcelona said the renovation is expected to cost €1.5 billion.

274.title: Didn't know Jiju story will blow up, it wasn't real: Twitter user after Tata Motors' reply
274.article_body: After Tata Motors replied to a Twitter user who said his "jiju" was threatening to call off the wedding with his sister over delay in delivery of car, the user clarified he made up the story. "Guys I'm sorry but I didn't know that my Jiju story will blow up to this level...That was not real," he tweeted.

275.title: Russia fines Twitter 3 mn rubles for not deleting banned content
275.article_body: A Russian court fined Twitter three million rubles ($41,000) for not removing banned content from its platform, local media reported citing the court. The illegal content reportedly included posts with instructions on how to make Molotov cocktails, among others. Earlier, Russia fined Google the same amount for refusing to remove banned content from YouTube.

276.title: I dedicate my last years to health: Tata at inauguration of Assam cancer hospitals
276.article_body: Ratan Tata, who accompanied PM Narendra Modi in inaugurating cancer hospitals in Assam on Thursday, said, "I dedicate my last years to health...Make Assam a state that recognises and is recognised by all." Earlier this year, the 84-year-old industrialist was conferred Assam's highest civilian award 'Assam Baibhav'. PM Modi on Thursday inaugurated seven cancer hospitals in Assam.

277.title: Future Retail directed to file reply on insolvency plea by May 12
277.article_body: National Company Law Tribunal (NCLT) has given Future Retail time till May 12 to file its reply to the insolvency plea filed by Bank of India. Future has defaulted on payment of ₹5,322.32 crore to a Bank of India-led consortium of lenders. This comes after Reliance called off its ₹24,713-crore deal with Future on Saturday.

278.title: Apple may make iPhones worth ₹47,000 crore in India this fiscal: Report
278.article_body: Apple's contract manufacturers in India are expected to make iPhones worth ₹47,000 crore in FY23,  The Economic Times reported. This will be almost five times the ₹10,000 crore worth of iPhones made by Apple's contract manufacturers Foxconn and Wistron in India in FY22, the report added. Earlier this month, Apple's manufacturing partner Foxconn began making iPhone 13 in India.

279.title: Bigg Boss 15's Vishal Kotian loses 15 kgs in 2.5 months, shares pic
279.article_body: Ex-Bigg Boss 15 contestant Vishal Kotian has revealed that he lost 15 kgs in 2.5 months after gaining weight during his low phase. "It was the 'Sultan' moment where Salman Khan looks in the mirror...realises that no I can't be this fat I have to get back...work harder," he stated. Vishal said he lost the weight for a role.

280.title: Israeli PM Bennett's family receives death threat, bullet in mail
280.article_body: Israeli PM Naftali Bennett's family has received a death threat and bullet in the mail for the second time in a week, police said on Thursday. According to an official, the target of the threats was Bennett's 17-year-old son Yoni, although the sender's identity hasn't been ascertained yet. Israeli authorities have increased the security arrangements for Bennett's family following threats.

281.title: China themselves haven't issued visas to us: India on suspending tourist visas
281.article_body: After India announced suspension of tourist visas issued to Chinese nationals, External Affairs Ministry Spokesperson Arindam Bagchi said, "China themselves haven't issued visas to us, have suspended (visa issuance to India) since 2020." He stated that government was aware of the COVID-19 situation in Chinese cities like Shanghai, adding it wasn't an "opportune time" for resuming visa issuance.

282.title: Petition to remove Amber Heard from 'Aquaman 2' receives 2 million signatures
282.article_body: A petition to remove Amber Heard from 'Aquaman 2' has reached over two million signatures, as the defamation trial brought by her ex-husband, actor Johnny Depp, continues. The petition says Heard "has been exposed as a domestic abuser by Johnny Depp". Depp claimed he was dropped from the 'Pirates of the Caribbean' franchise after allegations that he had abused Heard.

283.title: India doesn't need a national language, religion: Ex-J&K CM
283.article_body: Former Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Omar Abdullah on Thursday said that India doesn't need a national language or a national religion. "India is too diverse a country to have one national language. When you pick up an Indian currency note, how many languages do you find on it?" he said. India gives space to everybody, he added.

284.title: Google starts building 2nd largest campus outside US in Hyderabad
284.article_body: Google began building its largest campus outside of its US headquarters in Hyderabad's Gachibowli on Thursday. The 3 million-square-foot building will have a capacity to employ 14,000 people and is located on a 7.3-acre site. Google had acquired the land in 2019 after an agreement was signed between Google and Telangana's IT Minister KT Rama Rao in 2015.

285.title: US GDP falls 1.4% in Q1, 1st time since pandemic recession began
285.article_body: US GDP contracted 1.4% in the January-March 2022 quarter, the Department of Commerce said on Thursday. This was the first time that the US economy has contracted since the pandemic recession began two years ago. Department of Commerce's data showed personal consumption, the biggest part of the economy, rose 2.7% in Q1 2022 compared with 2.5% in Q4 2021.

286.title: Satellite pics suggest Russia using trained dolphins to protect naval base: Report
286.article_body: Russia deployed trained dolphins during its invasion of Ukraine to protect a Black Sea naval base, the US Naval Institute's news site USNI reported citing an analysis of satellite images. "Russian Navy has placed two dolphin pens at the entrance to Sevastopol harbour, sheltered just inside a sea wall," UNSI reported. "The pens were moved there in February," it added.

287.title: SBI denies no-dues certificate to farmer over 31 paise in Gujarat
287.article_body: The Gujarat High Court criticised SBI for withholding no-dues certificate of a farmer for pending dues worth 31 paise. The farmer needed the certificate for a land deal after he repaid the crop loan, TOI reported. "Outstanding of 31 paise? Do you know anything less than 50 paise is to be ignored?" Justice Bhargav Karia told SBI.

288.title: Shreya shares unseen pic with 'Scam 1992' co-star Pratik on his b'day
288.article_body: Actress Shreya Dhanwanthary, taking to Instagram Stories, shared an unseen picture with her 'Scam 1992: The Harshad Mehta Story' co-star Pratik Gandhi on his birthday on Thursday. Along with the picture, she wrote, "It's this jigar's birthday...Happy Birthdaaaaay my favourite nemesis." Shreya played the role of journalist Sucheta Dalal in the web series, which was directed by Hansal Mehta.

289.title: Lack of planning: BJP to Jharkhand govt over power cuts
289.article_body: The BJP has accused the JMM-led Jharkhand government of failing to provide a steady supply of electricity and adequate water to people amid the heatwave, calling it a result of "lack of planning". Former Jharkhand CM and BJP leader Raghubar Das said, "Presently, Jharkhand requires 2,300 MW to 2,600 MW of power but is getting barely 1200 MW."

290.title: Imported oil first taxed by Centre then states: Pawar on fuel price hike
290.article_body: Reacting to PM Narendra Modi's appeal to states to reduce VAT on fuel, Maharashtra Deputy CM Ajit Pawar said that imported oil is first taxed by Centre and then states. Pawar added that Maharashtra decreased taxes on CNG due to which it suffered loss of ₹1,000 crore. He further said Centre should adopt uniform taxation policy on fuel in country.

291.title: Raj govt should review law & order: NCW chief on Dausa rape case
291.article_body: After a woman was allegedly gangraped and murdered in Rajasthan's Dausa, the National Commission for Women Chairperson, Rekha Sharma, said that the state government should review law and order. Sharma, who met police officials and the woman's family on Thursday, said, "People have no fear of law, it seems." She sought the arrest of all the accused at the earliest.

292.title: Superb VFX, brilliant acting & direction: Akshay on Ajay's Runway 34
292.article_body: Akshay Kumar praised 'Runway 34' on Twitter after the film's lead actor and director Ajay Devgn held a special screening for the actor. "Brother Ajay...What a thriller...superb VFX, brilliant acting and direction," he tweeted. "Amitabh Bachchan...effortless as always," he added. Akshay also praised actress Rakul Preet Singh's performance. "May the film gets its due," Akshay concluded.

293.title: Cong protects rioters: BJP after anti-Sikh riots accused Tytler meets Sonia
293.article_body: Reacting to 1984 anti-Sikh riots accused Jagdish Tytler's meeting with Congress' Sonia Gandhi in Delhi on Thursday, BJP leader Shehzad Poonawalla alleged that the party "has always protected" and patronised rioters. "Congress will never stand for...victims of...riots...They have always rubbed salt on the wounds of...Sikh community," he added. The purpose of Tytler's visit, however, is not known.

294.title: Maha Minister Nawab Malik seeks interim bail on medical grounds
294.article_body: Maharashtra minister Nawab Malik, who was arrested by the Enforcement Directorate in a money laundering case, has sought interim bail from a special PMLA court on medical grounds. He had informed the court that he was unwell due to kidney ailments and had swelling in his legs. Malik was arrested on February 23 in connection with a money laundering probe.

295.title: Have declared 16 AIIMS across India since 2014: PM Narendra Modi
295.article_body: PM Narendra Modi, who visited Assam to lay foundation stone to various medical and developmental projects, said that his government has announced setting up of 16 AIIMS in the country after 2014. He added that AIIMS Guwahati was one of these projects. He tweeted, "Before 2014, there were only 7 AIIMS in the country. We declared 16 AIIMS across India."

296.title: 'Current health status: pissed off': Football superagent Raiola on reports of his death
296.article_body: After reports of his death surfaced online, football superagent Mino Raiola tweeted, "Current health status for the ones wondering: pissed off second time in 4 months they kill me. Seem also able to resuscitate." Raiola is currently admitted to the San Raffaele Hospital in Milan. Raiola's clients include Zlatan Ibrahimovic, Paul Pogba and Erling Haaland, among others.

297.title: 31-yr-old key accused in Jahangirpuri violence arrested from West Bengal
297.article_body: One of the main accused in communal violence that took place in Delhi's Jahangirpuri has been arrested from West Bengal, a Delhi Police Crime Branch officer said. The accused, 31-year-old Farid alias Neetu, is "one of the conspirators" and was "seen firing at the other community", the officer added. Post-riots, he escaped and hid in Tamluk, the officer further said.

298.title: Amber Heard's old chats with agent about break up with Elon Musk shown in court
298.article_body: Amber Heard spent time with Elon Musk while trying to reconcile with Johnny Depp, the ex-couple's agent Christian Carino said. Some of Carino's texts with Heard were shown in court, with Heard complaining about her break up with Musk in one. "Why'd you be sad if you weren't in love with him...You told me...you were just filling space," Carino replied.

299.title: DC to bowl first against KKR, KKR make 3 changes to their playing XI
299.article_body: Delhi Capitals (DC) captain Rishabh Pant won the toss and elected to bowl first against Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR). DC have made two changes to their playing XI, with Mitchell Marsh and Chetan Sakariya replacing Sarfaraz Khan and Khaleel Ahmed. KKR have made three changes, with Aaron Finch, Harshit Rana and Baba Indrajith being included in the side.

300.title: UP MLA scolds official for bulldozing house, says homes of poor shouldn't be razed
300.article_body: A video has surfaced online, showing BJP MLA Ketki Singh scolding an official in UP's Ballia for bulldozing a poor family's home. Singh could be heard saying, "I said one thing...why didn't you respect it?...[You used bulldozer's strength...we'll use the words' strength]." Later, Singh said that UP CM Yogi Adityanath has said that homes of poor shouldn't be razed.

301.title: Twitter reports revenue miss, user growth for Q1 days after Musk deal
301.article_body: Days after agreeing to sell to Elon Musk for $44 billion, Twitter released its earnings report for Q1 2022 on Thursday. Its daily active users number was up by 15.9% y-o-y to 229 million, compared with analysts' estimates of 226.8 million. However, Twitter's revenue was slightly below the estimated $1.23 billion. It earned $1.2 billion, an increase of 16% y-o-y.

302.title: Tempo driver arrested for raping 7-year-old girl in Mumbai
302.article_body: Mumbai police said that a tempo driver was arrested for luring a seven-year-old girl with chocolate and raping her in Ghatkopar. Officials said the 35-year-old accused was arrested within 24 hours of the incident. "Accused has been booked under section 376 (rape) and other relevant provisions of the IPC and Protection of Children from Sexual Offences (POCSO) Act," they added.

303.title: Elon Musk will not testify in Johnny Depp & Amber Heard's defamation trial
303.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk will not be testifying as a witness in Johnny Depp's defamation trial against ex-wife Amber Heard, the billionaire's lawyer Alex Spiro stated. Earlier, reports had said that Musk, who reportedly dated Amber in 2016, could be testifying in the court. Depp had alleged that Amber began dating Musk while she was still married to the actor.

304.title: Chennai man asks for sexual favours from woman during interview, held
304.article_body: The Greater Chennai Police on Wednesday arrested a 48-year-old man for allegedly demanding sexual favours from a woman during a job interview at his firm. The accused told the woman that in order to be selected, she would have to accompany him when he travels for outstation work and would have to share the room with him, police said.

305.title: NCB seize 50 kg of heroin, ₹30 lakh cash from Delhi's Jamia Nagar
305.article_body: The Narcotics Control Bureau (NCB) on Wednesday seized about 50 kg of "high-quality" heroin, 47 kg of other suspected drugs and ₹30 lakh in cash from Delhi's Jamia Nagar, the agency said on Thursday. The drugs were kept in backpacks, jute bags and wrapped in packets of e-commerce firms, said NCB Deputy Director General (operations) Sanjay Kumar Singh.

306.title: Attempt being made to disturb communal harmony in India: Pawar
306.article_body: NCP chief Sharad Pawar said that an attempt was being made to disturb communal harmony in the country. He said the Centre wasn't doing enough to control troublemakers in Delhi. Speaking about the Jahangirpuri violence, he said, "There were attacks on a particular section of the society. There was a conspiracy to spoil peace in the country."

307.title: Prashant Kishor's proposal had nothing on leadership: P Chidambaram
307.article_body: After poll strategist Prashant Kishor declined Congress' offer to join the party, senior leader P Chidambaram said that Prashant Kishor's proposals to restore the party had nothing regarding its leadership. "PK plan had nothing on leadership issue. Didn't hear of any Priyanka for president proposal either," he said. Kishor rejected Congress' proposal after various meetings with Congress leaders.

308.title: BJP didn't fight enough, workers felt abandoned: WB BJP MP
308.article_body: West Bengal BJP MP Arjun Singh said BJP didn't win the state's Assembly polls last year because "it didn't fight enough". "BJP lost [the Assembly polls] because of poor candidate selection...Organisationally, the party is very weak. It is evident from what we recently saw in Asansol," Singh said. "Many workers felt they were abandoned [during] the post-poll violence," he added.

309.title: PM Narendra Modi inaugurates 7 new cancer hospitals in Assam
309.article_body: PM Narendra Modi, along with industrialist Ratan Tata, inaugurated a cancer care centre and seven new cancer hospitals in Assam on Thursday. PM Modi said, "Cancer hospitals in Assam will augment healthcare capacities in Northeast [and] South Asia." He, however, added, "Hospitals are at your service, but I'll be happy if these new hospitals remain empty...I pray for your health."

310.title: Supplying Ukraine with weapons is threat to Europe's security: Russia
310.article_body: Russia said on Thursday that the West supplying arms to Ukraine poses a threat to Europe's security. Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov's remarks came in response to UK Foreign Secretary Liz Truss' comments on how countries should pledge more ammunition to Ukraine. Notably, Russian President Vladimir Putin has warned of "lightning-fast" retaliatory strikes to any foreign interference in Ukraine war.

311.title: 'Jiju threatening to call off marriage' says man on delay in car delivery; Tata replies
311.article_body: Tata Motors responded to a man complaining over delay in his car's delivery. He tweeted, "It's [been] more than 2 months...dealer has no idea on delivery date. My sister's marriage is at stake, My jiju is angry and threatening to call off marriage." Tata sought his contact details and wrote, "We never want our customers to have such an experience."

312.title: 171 students tested positive for COVID-19 at IIT Madras in 10 days
312.article_body: Twenty-six more people tested positive for COVID-19 at the Indian Institute of Technology, Madras on Thursday, taking the number up to 171 since the virus was first reported on April 19. "The number of positive cases is reducing day by day and the sample testing process is set to conclude likely today (Thursday)," said Health Secretary J Radhakrishnan.

313.title: Bitcoin adopted as legal tender in Central African Republic
313.article_body: The Central African Republic has adopted Bitcoin as legal tender, a spokesperson for President Faustin-Archange Touadera told Bloomberg on Thursday. "By legalising the use of Bitcoin, CAR hopes to attract investors," the spokesperson stated. Notably, it is the first African and only the second country in the world to do so after El Salvador, which adopted Bitcoin in September 2021.

314.title: Trump's Truth Social exists as Twitter censored free speech: Musk
314.article_body: Ex-US President Donald Trump's social media platform Truth Social exists because "Twitter censored free speech", Elon Musk, who's buying Twitter for $44 billion, said. However, he added that Truth Social is a "terrible" name and it should be called "Trumpet" instead. As per its website, Truth Social intends to give users space for "open, free and honest global conversation".

315.title: Only love & item songs are coming out from India: Grammy winner Ricky
315.article_body: Two-time Grammy Award winner Ricky Kej said he's chosen not to compose songs in Bollywood. The Indian composer stated he prefers making music from the heart. Ricky added, "While the quality of [film] music is very good, people aren't making music from the heart. The only type of music coming out from India are either item songs or love songs."

316.title: Russian-controlled region of Ukraine to start using rouble: Official
316.article_body: Ukraine's Kherson region, which has fallen to Russia amid invasion, will start using rouble as its currency from May 1, a pro-Russian committee official said. The official, Kirill Stremouso, stated that transition to rouble will take up to four months, during which time, Ukrainian currency will also be used. This comes amid reports of impending referendum by Russia in region.

317.title: Lucky to finish: Horner on Leclerc after spin during Emilia Romagna GP
317.article_body: Red Bull boss Christian Horner said Ferrari's Charles Leclerc was "lucky to finish the race" after spinning during the Emilia Romagna Grand Prix and finishing in sixth-place. Leclerc was chasing Red Bull's Sergio Perez before spinning off the track. "It just looked like he got a little bit too greedy on that Soft tyre, but mistakes can happen," Horner said.

318.title: I'm performing my last rites today: Mumbai man to wife before suicide
318.article_body: A lab assistant died by suicide after he appeared in front of a local train on Monday morning in Mumbai. Reportedly, two hours before the suicide, the man called his wife and said, "Today, I am performing my last rites [and] you perform your last rites." According to a report, the man killed himself due to a family dispute.

319.title: Nilekani helping govt build platform to take on Amazon, Flipkart: Report
319.article_body: Infosys' billionaire Co-founder Nandan Nilekani is helping the government build "a freely accessible online system where traders and consumers can buy and sell everything from detergent bars to airline tickets," Bloomberg reported. It is called the Open Network for Digital Commerce, or ONDC. Its objective is to curb Amazon and Walmart-owned Flipkart's domination in India, Bloomberg report added.

320.title: I feel sad for Sangram as I can't get pregnant, he loves kids: Payal
320.article_body: 'Lock Upp' contestant Payal Rohatgi broke down on the reality show and revealed that she cannot get pregnant. "We're trying [for] 4-5 years to have kids, I tried IVF, nahi ho raha (but it doesn't happen)," she stated. "I feel sad for Sangram because he loves kids, I can't have kids, he deserves to have his own kids," Payal added.

321.title: Amid loudspeaker row, MVA leaders to hold rally in Pune on April 30
321.article_body: Amid controversy over usage of loudspeakers at religious places, Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA) leaders will hold rally in Pune on April 30. This comes a day before Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) leader Raj Thackeray is slated to hold rally in Aurangabad. Our rally will counter BJP and MNS' "bitterness" amid their demand to pull down loudspeakers, a Congress leader said.

322.title: Delhi govt to increase water supply to meet growing demand in summer
322.article_body: The Delhi government on Thursday said it will supply around 1,000 million gallons of drinking water every day during summer as against 935 MGD earlier to meet the rising demand. "The system has been made efficient and robust so that there is no water scarcity in the summer season. The Water Minister is personally monitoring the situation," a statement said.

323.title: I'm going to take a break from acting for a little bit: Andrew Garfield
323.article_body: Andrew Garfield, during an interview, said he'll be taking a break from acting. "I'm going to rest for a little bit...I need to recalibrate...reconsider what I want to do next and who I want to be and just be a bit of a person for a while," he stated. Recently, Andrew earned his second Oscar nomination for 'Tick, tick...BOOM!'.

324.title: Venkatesh's only scored one 50 so far, he has to gain clarity: Lynn
324.article_body: Ex-KKR opener Chris Lynn said KKR's all-rounder Venkatesh Iyer has only scored one half-century so far in IPL 2022, and needs to try and gain some clarity when he walks out to bat. "The challenge for him is to...go back to the drawing board, build some confidence," added Lynn. Venkatesh has scored 126 runs in IPL 2022 so far.

325.title: Meta's shares surge 19% as Facebook reports user growth in Q1 2022
325.article_body: Facebook-parent Meta's shares surged 19% during pre-market trading in New York, a day after it reported that Facebook added more users than projected in Q1 2022. Facebook had 1.96 billion daily users in Q1 2022, a return to growth after its first-ever decline in Q4 2021, Meta reported on Wednesday. Meta's shares climbed as high as $210.14/share following the report.

326.title: 22,800 Russian soldiers killed in conflict so far, says Ukraine
326.article_body: Ukraine's Foreign Ministry on Thursday claimed that around 22,800 Russian soldiers have been killed since the Russian invasion began on February 24. Ukrainian forces have destroyed 970 Russian tanks and over 340 aircraft, including 155 helicopters, it added. Ukraine also claimed to have destroyed 2,389 armoured personnel carriers, 431 artillery systems and 151 multiple launch rocket systems.

327.title: Russia-Ukraine conflict has shown being self-reliant is a necessity: Rajnath
327.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh said that the Russia-Ukraine conflict has highlighted that being "self-reliant without dependencies" is a vital necessity. Indian Navy, which has been at the forefront of the government's 'Aatmanirbhar Bharat' initiative, must continue to lead the way, he added. He further informed that Indian Navy trained over 19,000 foreign personnel in the last four decades.

328.title: People didn't know Umran till IPL 2021, now everyone waits for him: Nikhil
328.article_body: Talking about SRH pacer Umran Malik, ex-India cricketer Nikhil Chopra said, "Until last year, most people didn't know him but everyone waits for him...this season." "Umran [has] got that 'X-factor'. He has the ability and pace and will be an asset for Team India in T20 World Cup 2022," added Nikhil. Umran recorded a five-wicket haul against GT.

329.title: AAP's Atishi to speak on Delhi govt's policies at UNGA
329.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party MLA Atishi will speak on the Delhi government policies at the United Nations General Assembly in a meeting on the 'New Urban Agenda'. "This is a great opportunity for governments to learn from one another and help people all over the world through policies that are closely connected to the needs of citizens," she said.

330.title: 35 kg heroin worth ₹175 crore seized during raids in Delhi, UP
330.article_body: In a joint operation, the Gujarat Anti-Terrorism Squad and a team of Delhi NCB seized 35 kilograms of heroin worth ₹175 crore from Delhi and UP's Muzaffarnagar on Wednesday. Moreover, four persons have been arrested in connection with the matter. Earlier on April 25, the Gujarat ATS seized over 50 kilograms of heroin worth ₹280 crore from a Pakistani boat.

331.title: PM Modi shares aerial pics of Brahmaputra river, calls it 'lifeline for Assam people'
331.article_body: During his visit to Assam on Thursday, PM Narendra Modi tweeted aerial pictures of the Brahmaputra river. "While on the way to Dibrugarh, caught a few glimpses of the magnificent Brahmaputra, which is a lifeline for the people of Assam and is an integral part of Assam's history and culture," he wrote with the pictures.

332.title: Taiwan records over 11,000 COVID-19 cases, highest so far
332.article_body: Taiwan saw a record number of single-day COVID-19 cases as it registered 11,353 infections on Thursday. Health Minister Shih-Chung Chen said that 99.7% of the infected patients had mild or no symptoms. Earlier this month, the government ended its "zero-COVID" policy despite the rise in the number of cases since late March.

333.title: Villarreal boss Emery warns Liverpool will 'suffer' in CL 2nd-leg clash
333.article_body: Villarreal manager Unai Emery said Liverpool "will suffer more" in the second-leg of their Champions League semi-final clash after Liverpool won the first-leg 2-0 on Wednesday. "The match next week will be very different than tonight. It's very important in our home to change something, maybe tactically," Emery said. "We can't dispute the result because they deserve it," he added.

334.title: Four black fungus cases reported in Bengaluru hospital
334.article_body: Amid surge in COVID-19 cases in Bengaluru, four patients have shown black fungus symptoms in city's Manipal Hospital. "Mucormycosis and Aspergillus are present in black fungus cases. Mucormycosis is more aggressive than Aspergillus. The treatment...for both types is anti-fungal medication," Senior Consultant, ENT, Dr Santosh Shivaswamy, said. On Wednesday, Bengaluru reported 114 COVID-19 cases.

335.title: 20 dead, thousands flee homes as gangs battle in Haiti
335.article_body: At least 20 people have been killed as violence in several neighbourhoods in the Haitian capital of Port-au-Prince worsened this week. The violence has forced thousands of people to flee their homes. Gangs have ramped up their battle for control over areas beyond their poorer neighbourhoods amid the power vacuum following the assassination of Haitian President Jovenel Moïse in July.

336.title: Union Minister explains why air ticket prices haven't come down
336.article_body: Union Minister Hardeep Singh Puri on Thursday asked if people ever wondered why air ticket prices haven't come down. Stating that Aviation Turbine Fuel constitutes about 40% of airline operations cost, Puri tweeted, "West Bengal, Maharashtra & Delhi impose massive 25%+ VAT on ATF while BJP states UP & Nagaland; & UT of J&K charge just 1%," he tweeted.

337.title: Shehnaaz to make her B'wood debut with Salman's 'Kabhi Eid...': Reports
337.article_body: Actress, former 'Bigg Boss' contestant Shehnaaz Gill will reportedly make her Bollywood debut with Salman Khan's 'Kabhi Eid Kabhi Diwali'. According to reports, the actress has joined the cast of the film and will be seen opposite actor Aayush Sharma. Speaking about the project, Aayush had said that he's looking forward to experimenting with his "cinematic aptitude" with this film.

338.title: T'gana Minister inaugurates Thermo Fisher's R&D facility in Hyd
338.article_body: Telangana Minister for IT and Industries KT Rama Rao (KTR) on Thursday inaugurated the Thermo Fisher research and engineering centre's India Engineering Centre (IEC) in Hyderabad. Thermo Fisher's IEC is being set up with an investment of about $15 million (₹1,14,89,70,000) and will employ over 450 diversely talented engineers and vendor partners.

339.title: It's a ridiculous turf war: Prakash on Devgn-Sudeep's national language debate
339.article_body: Actor Prakash Belawadi, who starred in 'The Kashmir Files', spoke about the recent national language debate between Ajay Devgn and Kiccha Sudeep. Prakash said it looks like a "ridiculous turf war". "Hindi isn't a national language because there's no designated national language in India...To convert this into an identity battle of your language versus my language is ridiculous," he added.

340.title: Bowlers are putting Kohli in a spot, letting him make a mistake: Vettori
340.article_body: Sharing his opinion on Virat Kohli who has scored 128 runs in IPL 2022 so far, ex-RCB captain Daniel Vettori said, "The bowler is putting Kohli in a spot and letting him make a mistake." "You...got to be all-out aggressive," added Vettori. Kohli was dismissed for nine off 10 balls against RR, having recorded two consecutive golden ducks before that.

341.title: EU nations paying for Russian gas in rubles must be penalised: Poland
341.article_body: Poland's Climate Minister Anna Moskwa said that the European Union should penalise countries that use rubles to pay for Russian gas. This comes after Russia's energy firm Gazprom on Wednesday halted gas exports to Poland and Bulgaria over the countries' refusal to pay for supplies in Russian currency. Reportedly, four European gas buyers have paid for supplies in rubles.

342.title: Meta reports 21% drop in profits in 2nd straight quarterly decline
342.article_body: Facebook parent Meta reported a 21% y-o-y decline in its profit for Q1 2022 at $7.5 billion, marking the company's second consecutive quarterly decline. Meta's revenue however grew 7% to $27.91 billion from $26.17 billion. Meanwhile, Facebook's daily active user count also increased 4% y-o-y to 1.96 billion after declining in Q4 2021 for the first time.

343.title: UP villagers thrash leopard to death after it attacks people in fields
343.article_body: Villagers in Uttar Pradesh's Bahraich thrashed a leopard with sticks and killed it after it attacked some people working in the fields. Thirteen people, including three women were injured in the incident. Some villagers also attacked the forest officials who had come to catch the leopard. An official said they are trying to identify the villagers who attacked the staff.

344.title: BJP claims 8 of the top 10 states with highest fuel prices are non-BJP ruled states
344.article_body: BJP has shared a list claiming that eight of the top 10 states with highest petrol and diesel prices in the country are non-BJP ruled states. According to BJP, Andhra Pradesh occupies the top spot where petrol was sold at ₹121.4/litre and diesel at ₹107/ litre on April 6. Madhya Pradesh and Bihar are also included in the list.

345.title: I've practiced choosing balls, bowlers to attack in death overs: Tewatia
345.article_body: GT all-rounder Rahul Tewatia has revealed that since getting the finisher's role in IPL, he has practiced choosing bowlers and balls to attack during the death overs. Against SRH, Tewatia came in to bat when GT were 122/3 and needed 74 runs to win off 40 balls. He then scored 40*(21) to help his side chase down the 195-run total.

346.title: Staff preoccupied, not available for demolition drive: Delhi Police
346.article_body: The Delhi Police on Thursday wrote to the South Delhi Municipal Corporation stating the officials were preoccupied to assist SDMC staff in carrying out an anti-encroachment drive in Sarita Vihar. "It is requested that prior intimation of at least 10 days may be given to fix the date for encroachment removal drive in the area," Delhi Police said.

347.title: Chhattisgarh govt to celebrate 'Mati Poojan Diwas' to promote natural farming
347.article_body: Chhattisgarh government announced on Wednesday that it will celebrate 'Mati Poojan Diwas' on May 3 to promote natural farming. According to a government circular, farmers and people would be encouraged to use vermicompost, cow urine and organic fertilisers instead of chemical ones. The programmes will be held at various panchayat levels as well as on the state level in Raipur.

348.title: 8 months' GST compensation sent to states, ₹78,704 cr pending: Govt
348.article_body: Finance Ministry on Wednesday said the Centre has released eight months of GST compensation for FY22 to states and compensation worth ₹78,704 crore is pending due to inadequate balance in the cess fund.
