During GST's implementation in 2017, Centre had agreed to compensate states till June 2022. It added that ₹7.35 lakh crore has been released to compensate revenue loss.

349.title: Actor Salim Ghouse passes away aged 70 due to cardiac arrest
349.article_body: Film and TV actor Salim Ghouse passed away aged 70 in Mumbai after suffering cardiac arrest. The last rites of the actor were performed early on Thursday morning. Ghouse started his acting journey in 1978 with the movie 'Swarg Narak', following which he featured in films like 'Chakra' and 'Saaransh'. He also featured in the TV show 'Bharat Ek Khoj'.

350.title: What are the highest targets achieved in the 20th over in IPL?
350.article_body: GT on Wednesday successfully chased down 22 runs required to win off the 20th over. It's the second-highest target achieved in the 20th over in IPL. RPS successfully chased down 23 runs off the last over against PBKS in IPL 2016 to record the highest target achieved in last over. Deccan Chargers, MI and RCB have chased down 21 runs.

351.title: Sleep with me or I'll get 20 more men: Russian soldier to pregnant teen before raping her
351.article_body: A 16-year-old pregnant girl in Ukraine's Kherson has revealed that she was threatened by a Russian soldier before he raped her. "When I resisted, he strangled me and said he'll kill me. Then he issued an unimaginable threat. He said either you sleep with me now, or I will bring 20 more people." the girl said.

352.title: Twitter-Musk deal includes $1 billion termination fee for both the parties
352.article_body: Elon Musk will have to pay Twitter a fee of $1 billion if he terminates his $44 billion cash deal for the social media company, according to a regulatory filing. Twitter will have to pay the same fee under specified circumstances if it terminates the deal. The deal could be terminated if not closed by October 24, the filing added.

353.title: Only 2 people have quit our tech team in 10 years: Zerodha's CTO
353.article_body: Unicorn startup Zerodha's CTO Kailash Nadh told Moneycontrol, "We have a technology team of just 33 people." He added, "Only two people have quit tech team in 10 years...that too for personal reasons." He explained, "We've kept it really simple, grounded and realistic...Aspirants are usually sold a vision about changing the lives of billions of people, we don't do that."

354.title: PL launches scheme to aid progress of South Asian football players
354.article_body: The Premier League has launched a scheme to aid the progress of young football players with South Asian backgrounds. It aims to improve coaching, playing and executive pathways for Asian, black and minority ethnic groups. Data from the Professional Footballers' Association shows there are 16 professional footballers with British South Asian heritage in the top four tiers of English football.

355.title: Andaman & Nicobar to get renewable energy-based power supply project
355.article_body: The central government will set up a renewable energy-based power supply project in Andaman and Nicobar Islands. The centre had signed a grant agreement with the Japan International Cooperation Agency to provide loan of $133 million in March for the same. The project, which will help in reducing the islands' carbon footprint, is expected to be completed by February 2024.

356.title: 2 Indian-origin men get jail for lying about vaccine status in Singapore
356.article_body: A Singapore court sentenced two Indian-origin men to five days in prison after one of them lied about his vaccination status to enter a bar. One of the accused, identified as 65-year-old Utheyakumar Nallathamby, had impersonated the other co-accused as he was unvaccinated and used the latter's credentials to enter bar. Nallathamby was caught after bar's assistant manager spotted him.

357.title: RCB share pics from ethnic-themed wedding party for Glenn Maxwell, Vini Raman
357.article_body: RCB took to Instagram to share pictures from ethnic-themed wedding party for Glenn Maxwell and Vini Raman. "Wedding vibes at the RCB camp last evening as we got together to celebrate #MaxiVins with a nice touch of Indian tradition," RCB wrote. The duo got married last month. Vini is an Indian-origin pharmacist based in Melbourne.

358.title: Praying for the safety of our Muslim brothers & sisters in India: German footballer Özil
358.article_body: German footballer Mesut Özil took to Twitter and wrote, "Praying during...holy night of Lailat al-Qadr for safety and well-being of our Muslim brothers and sisters in India." He added, "Let's spread awareness to this shameful situation! What is happening to the human rights in the so-called largest democracy in the world? #BreakTheSilence."

359.title: Finland and Sweden could join NATO quickly: Stoltenberg
359.article_body: NATO Secretary-General Jens Stoltenberg said Finland and Sweden will be able to join the military alliance "quickly" if they apply for membership. NATO would also try to find ways to ensure the two countries' security from the time they apply until they formally join, he added. Russia has threatened to deploy nuclear weapons to Baltics if the countries join NATO.

360.title: Congress leader Kamal Nath resigns as Leader of Opposition in MP
360.article_body: Congress leader Kamal Nath has resigned as the Leader of Opposition in Madhya Pradesh. Nath's resignation has been accepted by the Congress high command, All India Congress Committee General Secretary KC Venugopal said. Dr Govind Singh will be the Leader of the Congress Legislature Party in Madhya Pradesh, the Congress party said.

361.title: Sister asked 'Are you still in the film': Taapsee on working with SRK in Dunki
361.article_body: Actress Taapsee Pannu spoke about signing 'Dunki' alongside Shah Rukh Khan. She said, "It's too good to be true. I never...thought that I'll...someday reach this, forget about so soon." Taapsee revealed not just her, even her sister, Shagun Pannu, couldn't believe it. "Each time I went for [any] meeting with Rajkumar (Hirani)...she asked me, 'Are you still in the film'?"

362.title: Don't want to give her any importance: Ali Merchant on ex-wife Sara Khan
362.article_body: After Ali Merchant's ex-wife Sara Khan blamed him for her early eviction from 'Lock Upp', Merchant said, "[There were] claims that I was on the show because of her, well, tables have turned. Now she needs me to get the limelight." "I don't even want to give her any importance as it's not worth it," he added.

363.title: Liverpool’s Klopp hails ‘world class’ Mane after CL win over Villarreal
363.article_body: Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp hailed forward Sadio Mane after the Senegalese scored to help Liverpool beat Villarreal in their Champions League semi-final first-leg clash on Wednesday. "He can play left, he can play central, both positions world class," Klopp said. Mane, 30, has scored 20 goals in 44 appearances for Liverpool so far this season.

364.title: It's easy to be politically neutral: Billionaire Cuban to Musk
364.article_body: Billionaire investor Mark Cuban in response to Elon Musk's comment on making Twitter "politically neutral" said, "It's easy to be politically neutral. It's hard to be neutral about health and safety issues." Earlier, Musk said that to "deserve" the public's trust, Twitter "must be politically neutral". He added that it "effectively means upsetting the far-right and...far-left equally".

365.title: Russia-Ukraine war could last as long as 10 years: UK
365.article_body: United Kingdom's Foreign Secretary Liz Truss has said that the Russia-Ukraine war could last as long as 10 years. She further said that if Russian President Vladimir Putin succeeds "there will be untold further misery across Europe and terrible consequences across the globe". Truss in her speech called Putin a "desperate rogue operator".

366.title: 'Avatar 2' to release on Dec 16, film's footage screened at CinemaCon
366.article_body: The release date of James Cameron's 'Avatar: The Way of Water' has officially been announced at CinemaCon 2022. The film, which will be a sequel to the 2009 film 'Avatar', will release on December 16. Two scenes of the upcoming film were shown at the CinemaCon. 'Avatar: The Way of Water' will feature Sam Worthington and Zoe Saldana.

367.title: I'm concerned but not overly: Deep Dasgupta on Rohit and Virat's form
367.article_body: On being asked if Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli's form in the ongoing IPL season is a matter of concern, Deep Dasgupta said, "I'm not overly concerned...because it's different when you play for your country and when you play for franchises." In IPL 2022, Kohli has scored 128 runs in nine games while Rohit has scored 153 in eight matches.

368.title: South Korea to send gas to Europe amid energy crisis: Report
368.article_body: South Korea has decided to share liquefied natural gas (LNG) with European countries amid the energy crisis owing to restricted supply of Russian gas over Ukraine war, a report said quoting government officials. The country has the capability for providing such support in spring, however, the volume of shipment will "not be that much", according to an official.

369.title: Kohli got inner edges that missed the stumps vs RR, it's a worry: Bhogle
369.article_body: Commentator Harsha Bhogle said Virat Kohli got inner edges that missed the stumps during his knock of 9 off 10 balls in RCB's defeat by 29 runs against RR, which is a worry. "Kohli is just not able to get away in the powerplay," added Bhogle. "Keep backing him and hope that at some point the fine-tuning happens," stated Bhogle.

370.title: There's no area in Kashmir that is free from militancy: Omar Abdullah
370.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir is passing through a difficult phase, Omar Abdullah, former Jammu and Kashmir CM, said on Thursday. "The security situation is a cause of concern. There's no area in Kashmir that is free from militancy," Abdullah added. "There is very little economic activity, barring tourism. Jammu and Kashmir has high unemployment levels," Abdullah stated.

371.title: 18-year-old boy develops AI, sensor-based bicycle counter in B'luru
371.article_body: Bengaluru-based 18-year-old boy, Nihar Thakkar, has developed an artificial intelligence and sensor-based bicycle counter, which is said to be the first in India. The counter has been installed in Doddanekundi. He said, "[It's] powered by an AI-sensor camera and a machine learning-based algorithm where the data provided can be used to encourage cycling and to build more dedicated cycle lanes."

372.title: Indonesia export ban traps 2.9 lakh tonnes of palm oil for India: Report
372.article_body: Indonesia's palm oil export ban has trapped at least 2.9 lakh tonnes of palm oil shipments headed to India, Reuters reported citing industry officials. The widening of Indonesia's export ban and the consequent shipment disruptions will create vegetable oil shortage in India, the officials added. This comes shortly after India faced sunflower oil import shortages due to the Russia-Ukraine war.

373.title: 12-yr-old girl complains of back pain in UK, X-ray shows spine curved at 80-degree angle
373.article_body: A 12-year-old girl who complained about shoulder and back pain has been recommended urgent surgery by doctors in UK after an X-ray revealed her spine was curved at an 80-degree angle. The girl's mother said that the 12-year-old had rapid onset progression scoliosis. "If the bend starts going even further it can start crushing her lungs and heart," she added.

374.title: 1 in 5 reptiles found worldwide is threatened with extinction: Study
374.article_body: One-fifth of the reptile species found worldwide are threatened with extinction, a study stated. Out of the 10,196 reptile species examined, 21% are critically endangered, endangered or vulnerable to extinction as defined by International Union for Conservation of Nature. The threatened species include Galapagos tortoises, Indonesia's Komodo dragon, Africa's rhinoceros viper, India's gharial etc.

375.title: 12-yr-old B'deshi boy, who unknowingly entered India, reunited with family
375.article_body: A 12-year-old Bangladeshi boy, who unknowingly entered the Indian territory, was reunited with his family on Wednesday. The boy had entered India while sleeping in an Indian export truck that was parked in the area where he was playing with other children in Bangladesh. He was handed over to Border Guard Bangladesh (BGB) following paperwork, a BSF official said.

376.title: Russia says it will wait & see how Musk's ownership affects Twitter
376.article_body: Russian spokesperson Dmitry Peskov said on Thursday that Russia will wait and see how billionaire Elon Musk's ownership of Twitter will affect the platform. He also said that he doubted Western social media's capability to reflect different points of view. The statement comes as a Russian court reportedly fined Twitter $41,000 for not removing banned content from its site.

377.title: Probe into Bible-in-school row hurtful: Bengaluru Archbishop
377.article_body: Reacting to the probe ordered by the Karnataka government into the Bible row in the state, Bengaluru's Archbishop Peter Machado said, "I feel very hurt." "No student of any other religion had converted while studying in Christian schools," he added. He further said non-Christian students were not required to read the Bible and no Bible instructions were issued for them.

378.title: SSB Jawan blackmails, rapes 24-yr-old woman in UP's Lakhimpur Kheri
378.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Police have booked a Sashastra Seema Bal (SSB) jawan for allegedly raping a 24-year-old woman in Lakhimpur Kheri. The woman alleged that the jawan took her photos while she was bathing and also recorded a video of her in the bathroom. He blackmailed her and forced her to have sexual relations with him, she claimed in her complaint.

379.title: Panchkula woman trying to book chopper tickets online cheated of ₹2.2 lakh
379.article_body: A Panchkula resident was cheated of ₹2.2 lakh by a fraudster while trying to book a helicopter ride for Char Dham Yatra with her family. The complainant said she came across a website and submitted her contact details there. "We were told to pay 50% of ticket charges in advance and remaining amount two days before chopper ride," she stated.

380.title: Will wait for NTAGI's suggestion to vaccinate 5 to 12-year-olds: Govt
380.article_body: Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya on Thursday said the Centre will wait for National Technical Advisory Group on Immunisation's (NTAGI) recommendation to begin vaccination of 5-12-year-olds. This comes after Biological E's Corbevax and Bharat Biotech's Covaxin received emergency use authorisation for children aged 5-12 and 6-12 respectively. Vaccination for minors in India began on January 3.

381.title: If Pant is an MS Dhoni fan, he should learn from him: Virender Sehwag
381.article_body: Ex-India opener Virender Sehwag said DC captain Rishabh Pant should learn from former CSK captain MS Dhoni, if he is a fan of Dhoni. "Pant has the ability to score 20-25 runs in the final over, but for that he has to be at the crease," added Sehwag. Pant has scored 188 runs in IPL 2022 so far.

382.title: 33-yr-old BSF constable shoots himself dead in Chhattisgarh's Kanker
382.article_body: A 33-year-old Border Security Force (BSF) constable allegedly died by suicide by shooting himself with his service weapon in Chhattisgarh's Kanker, police said. The incident took place on Thursday morning at the BSF camp in Kamtera, police added. "On hearing the gunshot, his colleagues rushed to the spot and found him lying dead in a pool of blood," police stated.

383.title: US is 'out of pandemic phase' of COVID-19: Anthony Fauci
383.article_body: Top US health expert Dr Anthony Fauci said the US is "out of the pandemic phase" of COVID-19. "We are much, much better off than we were a year ago," Fauci said. "There's a lot of viral dynamics throughout the world and we still may get another variant which could lead to another potential surge," he added.

384.title: Air India's four Boeing 747 jets used for VIP travel deregistered
384.article_body: The Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) has deregistered four Boeing 747 jumbo jets of Tata-owned Air India. DGCA said if Air India wants to use these aircrafts again for commercial flights, they'll have to undergo a return-to-service programme for re-registration. Till about two years ago, these 30-year-old jets were being used by the President, Vice President and Prime Minister.

385.title: Weren't told one religion will get preferential treatment in India: Omar
385.article_body: National Conference Vice President Omar Abdullah said, "When we decided to accede to India, we acceded to a country where every religion would be treated equally. We were not told that one religion will get preferential treatment and others will be suppressed." He added that decision perhaps would have been different if people knew about it.

386.title: Delhi's Benito Juarez Marg underpass to be opened in May: Sisodia
386.article_body: Benito Juarez Marg underpass will be opened to the public next month, Delhi Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia said after he reviewed work on the stretch near South Campus. Once completed, the 1.8 km-long underpass is expected to provide relief to nearly 2.5 lakh commuters and travel to the airport and Gurugram will become smooth and traffic-free.

387.title: Sex racket operating in guise of spa busted in Delhi; 7 arrested
387.article_body: A sex racket that was being operated in the guise of a spa and massage parlour has been busted in Delhi's East Patel Nagar, police said on Wednesday. After receiving a tip-off, police carried out a raid at the massage parlour, 'The Space Spa', and arrested seven persons, including five women. Police have also recovered obscene material from the spot.

388.title: Pune ZP primary education dept to give 15% fee waiver to students
388.article_body: The primary education department of Pune Zilla Parishad (ZP) on Tuesday issued a notification stating that it will implement a 15% fee waiver for the academic year 2021-22 across all schools under its jurisdiction. Additionally, schools cannot halt online classes for a child if their parents were unable to pay the fees during the pandemic, an official said.

389.title: Had bad relationship after Romiit Raaj, realised I'm happy single: Shilpa Shinde
389.article_body: Television actress Shilpa Shinde, who was engaged to actor Romiit Raaj a few years ago said she realised she is happy being single. "After my engagement broke off...I did get into another relationship...that was very bad experience...I've realised I am happy being single...If someone asks me...where I am going or what I am doing...I can't keep answering him," she added.

390.title: SC upholds 6 years minimum age condition for Class 1 admissions in KVs
390.article_body: The Supreme Court rejected pleas challenging the raising of the minimum age required for admissions to Class 1 in Kendriya Vidyalayas to six years. The new rule will be applicable from 2022-2023 academic year. Earlier, the Delhi High Court had upheld the move by Kendriya Vidyalaya Sangathan, after which some parents took it up with the apex court.

391.title: Staff not available for anti-encroachment drive: Delhi Police to SDMC
391.article_body: Delhi Police on Thursday wrote to South Delhi Municipal Corporation (SDMC) stating that its staff is preoccupied and not available for the anti-encroachment drive in one of its wards. "It's requested that prior intimation of at least 10 days may be given to fix the date for encroachment removal drive in the area of Sarita Vihar Police Station," police added.

392.title: Ben Stokes named England's new Test captain
392.article_body: All-rounder Ben Stokes has been appointed captain of England's Test team by the England & Wales Cricket Board. Stokes succeeds Joe Root in becoming the 81st captain of England's Test team. "I am honoured to be given the chance to lead the England Test team. This is a real privilege and I’m excited about getting started this summer," Stokes said.

393.title: Funding for football in India drops by almost 85% in 4 years due to poor performance
393.article_body: The government has slashed its funding to the All India Football Federation (AIFF) by almost 85% over the last four years, citing 'poor performance' of the team. AIFF has seen its grants under Annual Calendar of Training and Competitions (ACTC) fall from ₹30 crore for 2019-20 to ₹10 crore in 2020-21 and further down to ₹5 crore this year.

394.title: Malaika Arora shares pic showing scar on her forehead after car accident
394.article_body: Actress Malaika Arora took to Instagram Stories to share a picture which shows a scar on her forehead. The actress had met with a car accident on April 2 and was taken to the hospital after she received an injury near her eye. Earlier, speaking about the accident, she had said, "I was in shock...There was too much blood."

395.title: He taught for 50 yrs, doesn't own land: Padma Shri awardee's daughter on eviction
395.article_body: The daughter of 91-year-old Odissi dancer Guru Mayadhar Raut, who was evicted by Centre from bungalow allotted on rent in Delhi's Asiad village in the 1980s, said she was serving lunch when officials arrived. "This is how brutally you treat this legend. He taught in Delhi for 50 years, and doesn't own an inch of land anywhere," said Madhumita Raut.

396.title: Human activity is leading to more disasters: UN report
396.article_body: Human activity is leading to an increase in number of disasters worldwide, a new UN report released on Tuesday stated. According to the report, between 350 and 500 medium-sized to major disasters were recorded annually over the last two decades. Humans have put themselves into a spiral of self-destruction by heating up the climate and ignoring risks, the report stated.

397.title: Plane's tyre bursts while landing in B'luru; 150 passengers escape unhurt
397.article_body: Around 150 passengers onboard a Thai Airways plane escaped unhurt after the airplane suffered a tyre burst ​while landing at Bengaluru airport on Tuesday. The ground staff informed the flight's pilot about the faulty tyre, following which, he manoeuvred the plane into a safe landing. Subsequently, the scheduled departure of the flight from Bengaluru to Bangkok on Wednesday was cancelled.

398.title: Don't feel for me: Parag on entrepreneur's 'I feel for Twitter CEO' tweet
398.article_body: Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal responded to an entrepreneur who had tweeted, "I feel for the current CEO of Twitter - he had all these plans and now lives with the same uncertainty of his whole team." Responding to entrepreneur Suhail Doshi, Agrawal tweeted, "Thank you but don't feel for me...What matters most is the service and the people improving it."

399.title: 7 IndiGo pilots found abusing over low salary on emergency frequency: Report
399.article_body: At least seven IndiGo pilots were allegedly found using offensive language on a frequency used for emergency communications, PTI reported. On April 9, these pilots were allegedly found using abusive language over low salaries on 121.5 MHz frequency, which is used for emergency communications only for the aircraft in distress. The DGCA has reportedly launched a probe in the matter.

400.title: 26 series were being shot when I was in Bhopal, no actor is out of work: Nawaz
400.article_body: Actor Nawazuddin Siddiqui said that the quality of web series is even worse than that of television serials but no actor is out of work these days. He said that everyone is busy and that it is a good thing. "I remember that I was shooting in Bhopal and 26 series were being shot there simultaneously," he added.

401.title: US President Joe Biden to visit South Korea, Japan in May
401.article_body: White House Press Secretary Jen Psaki on Wednesday said President Joe Biden will travel to South Korea and Japan next month over China's growing influence in the region and new threats from nuclear-armed North Korea. Biden will separately meet with South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol and Japanese Prime Minister Kishida Fumio during his trip from May 20 to 24.

402.title: MP Mahua criticises Decathlon, says 'store insists I give my number to buy pants for dad'
402.article_body: TMC MP Mahua Moitra complained about Decathlon store in Delhi and tweeted, "Want to buy my dad trousers for ₹1499 in CASH at Decathlon India...& manager insists I need to put in my mobile number & email ID to purchase." Stating that Decathlon is violating privacy and consumer laws, Moitra tweeted, "The sweet manager finally put in his number."
